properties.areaDesc: Central and Southwest Mountains; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 26 at 7:56PM MST until January 27 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Salt Lake City UT
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches,
with locally higher totals up to 11 inches possible. Snowfall
rates will average 1 to 2 inches per hour, with peak rates over
2 inches per hour possible.

* WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South
of I-80 and Central Mountains.

* WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Monday. The period of heaviest snowfall
will occur between 11 PM MST Sunday and 4 AM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and poor visibility
due to heavy snow at times. Travel impacts may linger into the
early portion of the Monday morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Mountain passes that will be impacted
include US-89 over Sardine and Logan Summits, I-80 over Parley's
Summit, the Cottonwood Canyons, I-70 over Clear Creek Summit,
and the SR-153 and SR-20 summits.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including
Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit
weather.gov/slc/winter.

For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of
Transportation, visit
http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial
511.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST MONDAY
